text:
Previously, running
batch workloads on Kubernetes

required a specific expertise
to set up and manage scheduling

and scaling for batch workloads,
which diverted time

and attention away from solving
core business problems.
Now, AWS Batch on EKS

helps manage the batch 
infrastructure for you,

handling the scaling 
of Kubernetes nodes,

placement of pods
in your batch workloads,

and scheduling of jobs
as defined by your priorities.

AWS Batch uses its own scaling
and scheduling mechanism,

so you can scale your resources
faster, be more accurate,

better utilize your 
EKS infrastructure,

and minimize 
workload starvation.

You can save time and effort
because AWS Batch offers managed

queuing, job lifecycle
management from start to finish,

and dependency management
between your jobs.
You can use AWS Batch to manage

a few dozen
or many thousands of jobs.

It tracks how much work is
waiting in the queue

and provisions the right type
and amount of compute resources

to execute the jobs
while driving high utilization
of the underlying EKS clusters.

Get started
today with AWS Batch on EKS.
